docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Monday:
New York City in 1975 was experiencing perhaps the worst moment in its history. The photographer Meryl Meisler loved it immediately.

headline.print_headline: A Dirty, Broke and Wonderful New York
headline.main: A Photographer’s Search for Joy in Uncertain Times

docs.snippet: Shares of Nvidia and Tesla were among the biggest losers in trading on Tuesday, as investors continued to lose interest in the once-hot tech sector.

headline.print_headline: A Rough Stretch for the Cars of the Future Drags Down Tech Shares
headline.main: Technology Companies Drag Stock Markets Down Again

docs.snippet: Singapore on Wednesday invited Human Rights Watch to give evidence at a parliamentary hearing on "fake news" as a dispute grew between the New York-based group and the city state.

headline.print_headline: Singapore Invites Rights Group to Fake News Hearing as Dispute Grows
headline.main: Singapore Invites Rights Group to Fake News Hearing as Dispute Grows

docs.snippet: Dropbox faces fierce competition, doesn’t make a profit and its user growth has slowed. Yet investors think the company has an amazing future.

headline.main: Dropbox’s First-Day Pop Should Give Investors Pause: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: Ahead of the first #MeToo Oscars, here’s a look at the staff who are The Times’s journalistic front line.

headline.main: How the New York Times Social Media Desk Covers the Oscars

docs.snippet: The S&P 500 and the Dow rose on Tuesday, led by gains in industrial and consumer staple shares, while weakness in technology stocks dragged down the Nasdaq.

headline.print_headline: Wall Street Wavers After Strong Rally, Tech Stocks Struggle
headline.main: Wall Street Wavers After Strong Rally, Tech Stocks Struggle

docs.snippet: If you didn’t know of Sam Nunberg, that likely changed after his onslaught of media appearances on Monday, when he said the special counsel had subpoenaed him.

headline.main: Sam Nunberg Cut Loose on TV News. But Who Is He?

docs.snippet: Technology companies led European stocks lower on Wednesday on persistent concerns over a regulatory crackdown and falls in major tech stocks overnight.

headline.print_headline: European Shares Feel Force of Tech Stock Sell-Off
headline.main: European Shares Feel Force of Tech Stock Sell-Off

docs.snippet: Jurors deliberated Wednesday whether the widow of the Orlando nightclub shooter lied to the FBI and helped her husband in the attack that killed 49 people or was an abused wife who knew nothing of his plans.

headline.print_headline: Jurors Begin Deliberations in Trial of Pulse Shooter's Wife
headline.main: Jurors Begin Deliberations in Trial of Pulse Shooter's Wife
